intro: Gaertnera spathacea, commonly known as the white spathaceous plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white bracts that surround small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Gaertnera spathacea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and unique floral structure.
